article_text:
“Here we go again,” says a Journal editorial. “A major U.S. company merges with a foreign firm in part to avoid America’s punishing corporate tax code, and the politicians who refuse to reform the code denounce the company for trying to stay competitive.” The politicians include Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders, who are attacking Johnson Controls for its planned merger with Tyco.

Since the price of oil collapsed, “the politicians and media commentators who a few years ago were outraged over rising gas prices,...

twitter.description: Clinton and Sanders and ‘Corporate Deserters.’ Plus the latest jolt to ObamaCare and why falling stock prices are good news in China.
